data.text: Religion and languages
Culture of a country
Our country is called the Islamic Republic of Pakistan as nearly 96% of the population are Muslims.
Hazrat Muhammad <FONT SIZE="16" COLOR="">(PBUH)</FONT> was the last messenger of Allah to whom the Holy Quran was revealed.
The followers of Islam are called Muslims. Muslims believe in only one God called Allah.
Muslims also believe that those who do good for others will be rewarded when they die with an afterlife in Paradise.
Hinduism is one of the oldest religions in the world.
The Bhagavad Gita is one of the holy books of the Hindus.
Christians are people who follow the teachings of the prophet Jesus Christ.
The Bible is the holy book of the Christians.
Sikhism is a religion preached by a saint called Guru Nanak.
The holy book of the Sikhs is the Guru Granth Sahib.
Gautama Buddha was the founder of Buddhism.
He became known as the Buddha or the Enlightened One.
Parsees follow the teachings of their prophet Zoroaster.
The holy book of the Parsees is called the Avesta.
Urdu is the national language of Pakistan.
Punjabi, Pashto, Sindhi, Balochi, and Gujrati are some other languages spoken in Pakistan.
